newsitem.title: CANADA: Barrick Gold Q3 falls on Peru charge.
newsitem.headline: Barrick Gold Q3 falls on Peru charge.

text.p: Barrick Gold Corp reported lower third-quarter earnings on Tuesday, blaming the drop on a US$38 million charge for bailing out of its Cerro Corona project in Peru.
Net income for the quarter fell to US$21 million or US$0.06 a share from US$67.7 million or US$0.19 cents per share a year earlier.
The Cerro Corona project cut earnings by US$0.10 a share, the company said.
Gold production rose in the quarter to 767,000 ounces from 734,000 ounces in the same period last year.
Cash operating costs in the quarter rose to US$203 an ounce from US$194 an ounce a year earlier, Barrick said.

But the average price the company received for its gold in the first nine months was US$415 an ounce, compared with an average spot price of US$392. The company said its hedging program helped it boost the average price.

Barrick completed its US$800 million acquisition of Arequipa Resources Ltd during the quarter. It also began production at its 400,000 ounce a year Meikle mine in Nevada and increased reserves at its Pascua mine in Chile, Barrick said.
